717291f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Waverly Place
717291f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, south from Waverly to Washington
Places, showing the old New York Hotel occupying the
entire frontage involved. This structure bore No. 721
and was a favorite resort of the Southerners before
and after the Civil War. Many stories were told of
how blockade running plots originated here. 1t was
erected in 1847. Randolph Cuggenheimer had it removed
in 1896 for his 12 story New York Commercial Building.
Note the absence of street car tracks.
About 1870
Gift of Urbrock Collection
